file.name: global-beta.yml
file.content:
openapi: 3.0.1
info:
  title: Global API Beta
  description: >
    Bandwidth's global API is an application programming interface for
    Bandwidth's global network.


    ## Versions


    |API Version|Description|Documentation|

    |:---:|:---:|:---|

    |`WS`|Our Legacy API version (`WS`) has been in a sunset period for an
    extended period of time. It has been deprecated and will be decommissioned
    on 8 August 2022. We require you to switch to `v1` as soon as
    possible.|[Click here](https://developers.voxbone.com/legacy/)|

    |`v1`|Our current API, which includes number ordering, compliance,
    configuration and inventory management to support your Voice and SMS
    communications.|[Click here](https://dev.bandwidth.com/apis/global/)|

    |`v2`|Our CDRs (Call Detail Records) API.|[Click
    here](https://dev.bandwidth.com/apis/global/v2/)|

    |`beta`|Early access to APIs under development including Number Whitelisting
    and Number Porting.|Currently viewing|


    ## Access


    Authentication for Bandwidth's global API is done with API keys. Please
    ensure:


    - Your account is activated for API access. You can do so on our [Global
    Portal](https://app.voxbone.com/home). If you have trouble, reach out to
    your account manager or raise a support ticket.

    - You've setup an API key. You can generate your API key under **Settings >
    API**.


    ## Environments


    There are currently two environments for our global APIs:


    | Environment | Base URL | Description |

    | --- | --- | --- |

    | Production | https://api.voxbone.com | Live production network. |

    | Sandbox | https://api.sandbox.voxbone.com | Intended for simulating
    ordering and address verification. You can test ordering without being
    charged, service activation and more. Any API calls performed through our
    Sandbox API can be viewed via our [Sandbox
    Portal](https://sandbox.voxbone.com/sandbox-v3/). |


    ## Security & Rate Limiting


    For protecting both your apps and our systems, a __20 requests per second by
    client IP__ is performed on your API calls. If you send more requests, your
    requests may be rejected by an `HTTP 509 Bandwidth Limit Exceeded` or `HTTP
    429 Too Many Requests` in the response.
  contact:
    name: users@cxf.apache.org
  version: '1'
servers:
  - url: https://api.voxbone.com/beta
tags:
  - name: Number Porting
    description: >
      Bandwidth understands that number porting is a powerful tool that enables
      you to bring all your existing voice services under one umbrella. 


      By bringing your existing phone numbers to Bandwidth, you can keep the
      numbers you have and mitigate the disruption that comes from changing
      number.


      We already take care of this for you but with our new Number Porting API
      we hope to make this process as smooth as possible! With our API you will
      be able to check number portability, submit port requests and view the
      status of an existing request.


      #####Limitations:

      Currently, Tollfree numbers from Germany and India are not supported for
      porting via API; please contact the Bandwidth LNP team for handling these
      requests.
  - name: Number Whitelisting
    description: >
      Number Whitelisting let's you take advantage of Bandwidth's network, but
      without necessarily buying Bandwidth numbers.
paths:
  /porting-api/eligibility/{number}:
    get:
      tags:
        - Number Porting
      summary: Check number portability
      description: Allows you to check number portability.
      operationId: checkNumberEligibilityUsingGET
      parameters:
        - name: number
          in: path
          description: Single number in E164 format.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: '3228080000'
        - name: ownership
          in: query
          description: Ownership type of the current number.
          schema:
            type: string
            enum:
              - BUSINESS
              - PERSONAL
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: >-
                  #/components/schemas/PortingResponse«NumberAdditionalInformationVO»
        '400':
          description: Bad Request
          content: {}
        '401':
          description: Unauthorized
          content: {}
        '403':
          description: Forbidden
          content: {}
        '404':
          description: Not Found
          content: {}
      security:
        - apiKey: []
    x-summary: Check number portability
    x-description: >
      Check if a single number is portable to Bandwidth. Support for multiple
      numbers and ranges will be coming in future iterations of the API and you
      can use the portal to port these numbers if required.


      Bandwidth internally detects the number type, area code and country code
      and you can retrieve porting pricing fees and submission requirements.
  /porting-api:
    get:
      tags:
        - Number Porting
      summary: Check all porting requests with filters
      description: >-
        Allows you to check all existing porting requests for your account using
        available filters for example the number or current status.
      operationId: getPortInRequestsUsingGET
      parameters:
        - name: status
          in: query
          description: The status of your existing port request.
          schema:
            type: string
            enum:
              - documentsNeeded
              - pendingDocumentReview
              - canceled
              - rejected
              - pendingCarrierApproval
          example: documentsNeeded
        - name: e164
          in: query
          description: The number you are porting.
          schema:
            type: string
          example: '3228080000'
        - name: type
          in: query
          description: The type of number you are porting.
          schema:
            type: string
            enum:
              - GEOGRAPHIC
              - SHARED_COST
              - TOLL_FREE
              - NATIONAL
              - SPECIAL
              - MOBILE
              - INUM
          example: GEOGRAPHIC
        - name: countryCodeA3
          in: query
          description: ISO 3166-1 standard 3-letter country code.
          schema:
            type: string
          example: BEL
        - name: expectedPortCompleteDate
          in: query
          description: >-
            Estimated completion timestamp, calculated by adding lead time to
            date of submission. Only present once a request has state
            `SUBMITTED`
          schema:
            type: string
            format: date
          example: '2019-11-20'
        - name: preferredPortingDate
          in: query
          description: >-
            Date you requested for the porting to be completed in YYYY-MM-DD
            format.
          schema:
            type: string
          example: 2019-11-20T00:00:00.000Z
        - name: dateCreated
          in: query
          description: >-
            Timestamp representing when the initial porting request was created
            with Bandwidth.
          schema:
            type: string
            format: date-time
          example: 2019-11-20T00:00:00.000Z
        - name: dateSubmitted
          in: query
          description: >-
            Timestamp representing when the request was submitted to Bandwidth.
            Only present when relevant, while the request is being handled by
            Bandwidth.
          schema:
            type: string
            format: date-time
          example: 2019-11-20T00:00:00.000Z
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortingResponse«Page«PortInRequestVO»»'
        '400':
          description: Bad Request
          content: {}
        '401':
          description: Unauthorized
          content: {}
        '403':
          description: Forbidden
          content: {}
        '404':
          description: Not Found
          content: {}
      security:
        - apiKey: []
    post:
      tags:
        - Number Porting
      summary: Create individual porting request
      description: >-
        Allows you to create a porting request in a pending state without
        documents. These documents must be uploaded for this porting request to
        be processed successfully.
      operationId: createPortInRequestUsingPOST
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortInRequestCreationVO'
        required: true
      responses:
        '201':
          description: Created
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortingResponse«PortInRequestVO»'
        '400':
          description: Bad Request
          content: {}
        '401':
          description: Unauthorized
          content: {}
        '403':
          description: Forbidden
          content: {}
        '404':
          description: Not Found
          content: {}
      security:
        - apiKey: []
      x-codegen-request-body-name: portRequest
    x-summary: Create or list porting request
    x-description: >
      All porting requests are created in a pending state until all the required
      information has been submitted. 


      Once all required information along with supporting documents are updated,
      the request will automatically be submitted to Bandwidth.


      ### Port Request States
       |Status|Description|
       |:--:|:-----|
       __MISSING_DOCUMENTS__ | Draft port request has been created and documents need to be uploaded.
       __SUBMITTED__ |  LOA and last invoice scan were sent by customer and the request can be analyzed by our Carrier Dpt.
       __CHANGES_REQUESTED__ | After analysis of LOA, invoice and address, some mandatory info is missing. This places the request in pending until the customer updates and re-submits their request.
       __PENDING_CARRIER_APPROVAL__ | This is where the request is being investigated and we are waiting for a response from our carrier.
       __ACCEPTED__ | We are able to port the number.
       __READY_FOR_CONFIGURATION__ | Numbers related to the request have been created in the customer account for configuration purposes. This is an intermediary step before `COMPLETED`. At this point, you can [__configure Voice URIs__](https://docs.voxbone.com/#/reference/voice) on the ported numbers.
       __COMPLETED__ | The number has been ported to the Bandwidth network.
       __REJECTED__ | We are unable to port the number at the current time.
       __PROCESSING_CANCELLATION__ | The customer wants to cancel the request, a cancellation invoice should be issued. If any number is already created, it should be flagged as cancelled.
       __CANCELED__ | Where the customer has canceled the request for any reason.
  /porting-api/{portingInRequestId}/documents:
    post:
      tags:
        - Number Porting
      summary: Upload multiple supporting documents
      description: Upload multiple supporting documents.
      operationId: uploadPortingInDocumentsUsingPOST
      parameters:
        - name: portingInRequestId
          in: path
          description: portingInRequestId
          required: true
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int32
      requestBody:
        content:
          multipart/form-data:
            schema:
              properties:
                LOA:
                  type: string
                  description: Letter of authorization document.
                  format: binary
                COB:
                  type: string
                  description: Last invoice
                  format: binary
                EU_ID:
                  type: string
                  description: Copy of end user's photo ID
                  format: binary
                POA:
                  type: string
                  description: Company Registration Certificate / Copy of power of attorney
                  format: binary
                COURT:
                  type: string
                  description: Copy of Court Registration
                  format: binary
                LEG_ID:
                  type: string
                  description: Copy of legal representative's photo ID
                  format: binary
                SIG_ID:
                  type: string
                  description: Copy of LOA signatory´s photo ID
                  format: binary
                TRADE:
                  type: string
                  description: >-
                    Copy of the company registration in the Trade Registry
                    Gazette
                  format: binary
                TAX:
                  type: string
                  description: Copy of the registration at the tax office
                  format: binary
                OFF_SGN:
                  type: string
                  description: Official proof of signature
                  format: binary
                DIREC:
                  type: string
                  description: >-
                    Copy of Certificate of Directors and Secretary of the
                    company
                  format: binary
                INCORP:
                  type: string
                  description: Copy of Certificate of Incorporation
                  format: binary
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            multipart/form-data:
              schema:
                $ref: >-
                  #/components/schemas/PortingResponse«List«PortInRequestDocumentVO»»
        '201':
          description: Created
          content: {}
        '400':
          description: Bad Request
          content: {}
        '401':
          description: Unauthorized
          content: {}
        '403':
          description: Forbidden
          content: {}
        '404':
          description: Not Found
          content: {}
      security:
        - apiKey: []
    x-summary: Upload documents
    x-description: >
      You are required to upload all the relevant documents for your existing
      porting request to be successful depending on the number you are trying to
      port and which country the number belongs to. You can see the required
      documents from checking a numbers portability requirements.


      ### Required documents can include:
       |Type|Description|
       |:--:|:-----|
       __LOA__ | A letter of authority.
       __COB__ | Last invoice.
       __POA__ | Company Registration Certificate / Copy of power of attorney.
       __LEG_ID__ | Copy of legal representative's photo ID.
       __COURT__ | Copy of Court Registration .
       __SIG_ID__ | Copy of LOA signatory´s photo ID.
       __TRADE__ | Copy of the company registration in the Trade Registry Gazette.
       __TAX__ | Copy of the registration at the tax office.
       __OFF_SGN__ | Official proof of signature.
       __DIREC__ |  Copy of Certificate of Directors and Secretary of the company.
       __OFF_SGN__ | Copy of Certificate of Incorporation.
  /porting-api/{portingInRequestId}/documents/{documentId}:
    get:
      tags:
        - Number Porting
      summary: Download individual document
      description: Download individual document
      operationId: downloadDocumentUsingGET
      parameters:
        - name: Accept
          in: header
          description: Accept
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/octet-stream
        - name: portingInRequestId
          in: path
          description: The ID generated when you submitted your porting request.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int32
          example: 12124
        - name: documentId
          in: path
          description: The ID generated when you submitted your document.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int32
          example: 11234
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            '*/*':
              schema:
                $ref: >-
                  #/components/schemas/PortingResponse«List«PortInRequestDocumentVO»»
        '400':
          description: Bad Request
          content: {}
        '401':
          description: Unauthorized
          content: {}
        '403':
          description: Forbidden
          content: {}
        '404':
          description: Not Found
          content: {}
      security:
        - apiKey: []
    x-summary: Download documents
    x-description: >
      Allows you to download specific documents you have uploaded to review for
      a specific porting request.
  /porting-api/{portingInRequestId}:
    get:
      tags:
        - Number Porting
      summary: Check specific porting request by ID
      description: Allows you to check the status of an existing porting request.
      operationId: getPortInRequestUsingGET
      parameters:
        - name: portingInRequestId
          in: path
          description: The ID generated when you submitted your porting request.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int32
          example: 12124
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortingResponse«PortInRequestVO»'
        '400':
          description: Bad Request
          content: {}
        '401':
          description: Unauthorized
          content: {}
        '403':
          description: Forbidden
          content: {}
        '404':
          description: Not Found
          content: {}
      security:
        - apiKey: []
    put:
      tags:
        - Number Porting
      summary: Update specific porting request without documents
      description: >-
        Allows you to update any user information or the preferred porting date
        if this is done before Bandwidth reviews the porting request.
      operationId: editPortInRequestWithoutDocumentsUsingPUT
      parameters:
        - name: portingInRequestId
          in: path
          description: The ID generated when you submitted your porting request.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int32
          example: 12124
      requestBody:
        description: portInRequestEditVO
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortInRequestEditVO'
        required: true
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortingResponse«PortInRequestVO»'
        '201':
          description: Created
          content: {}
        '400':
          description: Bad Request
          content: {}
        '401':
          description: Unauthorized
          content: {}
        '403':
          description: Forbidden
          content: {}
        '404':
          description: Not Found
          content: {}
      security:
        - apiKey: []
      x-codegen-request-body-name: portInRequestEditVO
    delete:
      tags:
        - Number Porting
      summary: Cancel specific porting request
      description: >-
        Cancelling existing porting requests will incur a cancellation fee if
        the number has not been ported.
      operationId: cancelPortingInRequestUsingDELETE
      parameters:
        - name: portingInRequestId
          in: path
          description: The ID generated when you submitted your porting request.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int32
          example: 12124
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortingResponse«PortInRequestVO»'
        '204':
          description: No Content
          content: {}
        '401':
          description: Unauthorized
          content: {}
        '403':
          description: Forbidden
          content: {}
      security:
        - apiKey: []
    x-summary: Get, update or delete specific porting request
    x-description: >
      All porting requests are created in pending state until all required
      information is submitted. 


      Once all required information including documents are updated, the request
      will automatically be submitted to Bandwidth for porting.
  /whitelist:
    get:
      tags:
        - Number Whitelisting
      summary: |
        List whitelisted numbers
      description: >
        Allows you to retrieve your whitelisted inventory. Filters and sorting
        parameters are supported.
      operationId: searchExternalDidsUsingGET
      parameters:
        - name: countryCodeA3
          in: query
          description: countryCodeA3
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: offset
          in: query
          description: offset
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int32
            default: 0
        - name: limit
          in: query
          description: limit
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int32
            default: 20
        - name: sort
          in: query
          description: sort
          schema:
            type: string
            default: e164
        - name: order
          in: query
          description: order
          schema:
            type: string
            default: asc
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/WhitelistApiListResponse'
      security:
        - apiKey:
            - yourKey
    put:
      tags:
        - Number Whitelisting
      summary: |
        Whitelist a number
      description: >
        Allows you to add a number to your whitelist inventory. In case a number
        is already present in your inventory, it will be updated.
      operationId: uploadExternalDidUsingPUT
      requestBody:
        description: externalDidVO
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: '#/components/schemas/WhitelistDidObject'
        required: true
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/WhitelistApiResponse'
      security:
        - apiKey:
            - yourKey
      x-codegen-request-body-name: externalDidVO
    x-summary: |
      Create or list whitelisted numbers
  /whitelist/{e164}:
    get:
      tags:
        - Number Whitelisting
      summary: |
        Get a specific whitelisted number
      description: >
        Allows you to retrieve all info about a specific number in your
        whitelisted inventory.
      operationId: getByE164UsingGET
      parameters:
        - name: e164
          in: path
          description: e164
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/WhitelistApiResponse'
      security:
        - apiKey:
            - yourKey
    delete:
      tags:
        - Number Whitelisting
      summary: |
        Delete a whitelisted number
      description: |
        Allows you to remove a number from your whitelisted inventory.
      operationId: deleteExternalDidUsingDELETE
      parameters:
        - name: e164
          in: path
          description: >-
            The DID in its E164 format (e.g. +16469185038) with the ability to
            provide multiple E164s.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/WhitelistApiResponse'
      security:
        - apiKey:
            - yourKey
    x-summary: |
      List or delete a specific whitelisted number
components:
  schemas:
    DocumentRequiredInformationVO:
      type: object
      properties:
        type:
          type: string
          description: The type/name of the document.
          example: LOA
          enum:
            - LOA
            - COB
            - EU_ID
            - POA
            - COURT
            - LEG_ID
            - SIG_ID
            - TRADE
            - TAX
            - OFF_SGN
            - DIREC
            - INCORP
        description:
          type: string
          description: Short description for the content and nature of required document.
          example: Letter of authorization.
        sourceDocument:
          type: string
          description: >-
            URL to retrieve the source document. Only present for documents to
            be signed, most commonly the LOA. If present, the source document
            needs to be downloaded, signed and uploaded by the requestor.
          example: https://beta.voxbone.com/ports/documents/loas/BEL/2/loa.pdf
        supportedFileTypes:
          type: array
          description: List of accepted file formats for uploaded documents.
          items:
            type: string
            enum:
              - .jpg
              - .png
              - .pdf
              - .xls
              - .xlsx
      description: >-
        Data structure for the document object defining the required documents,
        their types and source/sample document if applicable.
      example:
        type: LOA
        description: Letter of authorization.
        sourceDocument: https://beta.voxbone.com/ports/documents/loas/BEL/2/loa.pdf
    EndUserRequiredInformationVO:
      type: object
      properties:
        buildingNumber:
          type: string
          description: Building number for the end user address
          example: '489'
        city:
          type: string
          description: City name for the end user address
          example: Brussels
        countryCodeA3:
          type: string
          description: ISO 3166-1 standard 3-letter country code
          example: BEL
        postalCode:
          type: string
          description: Postal code for the end user address
          example: '1050'
        streetName:
          type: string
          description: Street name for the end user address
          example: Rue Vanderkindere
        title:
          type: string
          description: Title of the end user
          enum:
            - MR
            - MS
            - MRS
    NumberAdditionalInformationVO:
      type: object
      properties:
        e164:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The number in E164 format the portability check response is executed
            against
          example: '3228080000'
        areaCode:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The area code of the phone number portability check response is
            executed against
          example: '2'
        portable:
          type: boolean
          description: >-
            Whether or not the number specified in the portability check request
            can be ported in to Bandwidth network
          example: true
        portFees:
          type: number
          description: >-
            Total cost of porting the specified number(s) into Bandwidth. Covers
            port request fee and per number fee(s). In account currency.
          example: 25
        leadTime:
          type: integer
          description: >-
            Estimated time required to complete the porting process, based on
            our experience with the local provider, in working days.
          format: int32
          example: 10
        cancellationFees:
          type: number
          description: >-
            Cost of cancellation of a port request once it's submitted. Doesn't
            apply to all countries and might be `0`. In account currency.
          example: 10
        carrierName:
          type: string
          description: The current carrier for the number to be ported.
          example: TELIMIT, S.L.
        countryCode:
          type: integer
          description: Unique identifier for a country.
          format: int32
          example: 34
        countryCodeA3:
          type: string
          description: ISO 3166-1 standard 3-letter country code.
          example: BEL
        didMonthlyFees:
          type: number
          description: >-
            Monthly price for the number(s) once they're ported in to Bandwidth.
            If multiple numbers are provided, the value will show the total. In
            account currency.
          example: 4.95
        eligibleProviders:
          type: array
          description: >-
            For some countries and number types, we are able to only port out
            from a specified list of losing carriers. For such countries, the
            `currentProviderName` needs to be set and validated against the
            returned list.
          example:
            - Orange Business Belgium
            - BASE
          items:
            type: string
        internalMigration:
          type: boolean
          description: >-
            Whether or not the requested number already is operating within
            Bandwidth network, i.e. belongs to a different Bandwidth account.
          example: false
        nonPortabilityReason:
          type: string
          description: The reason why we are not able to port this number to Bandwidth.
        requirements:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortingRequiredInformationVO'
        type:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The type of phone number portability check response is executed
            against
          example: GEOGRAPHIC
          enum:
            - GEOGRAPHIC
            - SHARED_COST
            - TOLL_FREE
            - NATIONAL
            - SPECIAL
            - MOBILE
            - INUM
    Page«PortInRequestVO»:
      type: object
      properties:
        content:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortInRequestVO'
        first:
          type: boolean
          example: true
        last:
          type: boolean
          example: true
        number:
          type: integer
          format: int32
          example: 1
        numberOfElements:
          type: integer
          format: int32
          example: 5
        size:
          type: integer
          format: int32
          example: 20
        totalElements:
          type: integer
          format: int64
          example: 5
        totalPages:
          type: integer
          format: int32
          example: 1
    PortInRequestCreationVO:
      type: object
      properties:
        currentProviderName:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The losing carrier who's currently the operator on the number to be
            ported in. In countries where there's a requirement of
            `eligibleProviders` in the `/eligibility` response, this value has
            to be one of the members of the `eligibleProviders` array and
            validated against these values.
          example: Orange Business Belgium
        e164:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The number in E164 format the portability check response is executed
            against
          example: '3228080000'
        preferredPortingDate:
          type: string
          description: Specific date you would prefer the porting to be completed.
          format: date
          example: '2019-11-20'
        endUser:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortInRequestEndUserVO'
    PortInRequestDocumentVO:
      type: object
      properties:
        description:
          type: string
          description: Short description for the content and nature of required document.
          example: Last invoice
        documentId:
          type: integer
          description: Unique identifier for the uploaded document
          format: int32
        documentUrl:
          type: string
          description: Link to retrieve a previously uploaded document
          example: >-
            https://beta.voxbone.com/ports/577a876d-e084-4785-8ef8-13d3f6654f42/documents/1234-fadw5213-rgsmdf22-9999.pdf
        status:
          type: string
          description: The current status of the document you have uploaded
          example: VALID
          enum:
            - PENDING_VALIDATION
            - VALID
            - INVALID
        type:
          type: string
          description: The type/name of the document.
          example: LOA
          enum:
            - LOA
            - COB
            - EU_ID
            - POA
            - COURT
            - LEG_ID
            - SIG_ID
            - TRADE
            - TAX
            - OFF_SGN
            - DIREC
            - INCORP
    PortInRequestEditVO:
      type: object
      properties:
        currentProviderName:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The losing carrier who's currently the operator on the number to be
            ported in. In countries where there's a requirement of
            `eligibleProviders` in the `/eligibility` response, this value has
            to be one of the members of the `eligibleProviders` array and
            validated against these values.
          example: Orange Business Belgium
        endUser:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortInRequestEndUserVO'
        preferredPortingDate:
          type: string
          description: Date you would like porting to be completed
          format: date
          example: '2019-11-20'
    PortInRequestEndUserVO:
      type: object
      properties:
        buildingNumber:
          type: string
          description: Building number for the end user address
          example: '489'
        city:
          type: string
          description: City name for the end user address
          example: Brussels
        company:
          type: string
          description: Registered company name. Only present for `business` ownership type.
          example: Bandwidth
        countryCodeA3:
          type: string
          description: ISO 3166-1 standard 3-letter country code.
          example: BEL
        firstName:
          type: string
          description: First name of the end user
          example: Joe
        lastName:
          type: string
          description: Surname of the end user
          example: Bloggs
        ownership:
          type: string
          description: Type of ownership of the number to be ported.
          enum:
            - BUSINESS
            - PERSONAL
        postalCode:
          type: string
          description: Postal code for the end user address
          example: '1050'
        streetName:
          type: string
          description: Street name for the end user address
          example: Rue Vanderkindere
        title:
          type: string
          description: Title of the end user
          enum:
            - MR
            - MS
            - COMPANY
        vatNumber:
          type: boolean
          description: >-
            Whether or not the registered VAT number for the business is
            required
          example: false
    PortInRequestVO:
      type: object
      properties:
        areaCode:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The area code of the phone number portability check response is
            executed against
          example: '2'
        cancellationFees:
          type: number
          description: >-
            Cost of cancellation of a port request once it's submitted. Doesn't
            apply to all countries and might be `0`. In account currency.
          example: 10
        countryCodeA3:
          type: string
          description: ISO 3166-1 standard 3-letter country code.
          example: BEL
        currentProviderName:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The losing carrier who's currently the operator on the number to be
            ported in. In countries where there's a requirement of
            `eligibleProviders` in the `/eligibility` response, this value has
            to be one of the members of the `eligibleProviders` array and
            validated against these values.
          example: Orange Business Belgium
        dateCreated:
          type: string
          description: Timestamp representing when the document was uploaded
          format: date-time
          example: 2018-04-21T09:19:02.000Z
        dateSubmitted:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Timestamp representing when the request was submitted to Bandwidth.
            Only present when relevant, while the request is being handled by
            Bandwidth.
          format: date-time
          example: 2018-04-22T23:02:25.000Z
        didMonthlyFees:
          type: number
          description: >-
            Monthly price for the number(s) once they're ported in to Bandwidth.
            If multiple numbers are provided, the value will show the total. In
            account currency.
          example: 4.95
        documents:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortInRequestDocumentVO'
        e164:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The number in E164 format the portability check response is executed
            against
          example: '3228080000'
        endUser:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortInRequestEndUserVO'
        expectedPortCompleteDate:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Estimated completion timestamp, calculated by adding lead time to
            date of submission. Only present once a request has state
            `SUBMITTED`
          format: date-time
          example: 2018-04-23T12:45:12.000Z
        internalMigration:
          type: boolean
          description: >-
            Whether or not the requested number already is operating within
            Bandwidth's network, i.e. belongs to a different Bandwidth account.
          example: false
        lastUpdate:
          type: string
          description: Timestamp representing when the request was updated.
          format: date-time
          example: 2018-04-23T12:45:12.000Z
        leadTime:
          type: integer
          description: >-
            Estimated time required to complete the porting process, based on
            our experience with the local provider, in working days.
          format: int32
          example: 10
        portFees:
          type: number
          description: >-
            Total cost of porting the specified number(s) into Bandwidth. Covers
            port request fee and per number fee(s). In account currency.
          example: 25
        preferredPortingDate:
          type: string
          description: Specific date you would prefer the porting to be completed.
          format: date
          example: '2019-11-20'
        requestId:
          type: integer
          description: Unique identifier pointing to a specific port in request
          format: int32
        status:
          type: string
          example: MISSING_DOCUMENTS
          enum:
            - SUBMITTED
            - MISSING_DOCUMENTS
            - CHANGES_REQUESTED
            - PENDING_CARRIER_APPROVAL
            - PROCESSING_CANCELLATION
            - CANCELED
            - ACCEPTED
            - REJECTED
            - COMPLETED
            - READY_FOR_CONFIGURATION
        type:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The type of phone number portability check response is executed
            against
          enum:
            - GEOGRAPHIC
            - SHARED_COST
            - TOLL_FREE
            - NATIONAL
            - SPECIAL
            - MOBILE
            - INUM
    PortingRequiredInformationVO:
      type: object
      properties:
        business:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/UserRequiredInformationVO'
        personal:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/UserRequiredInformationVO'
    PortingResponseErrorMessage:
      type: object
      properties:
        description:
          type: string
    PortingResponse«List«PortInRequestDocumentVO»»:
      type: object
      properties:
        data:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortInRequestDocumentVO'
        messages:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortingResponseErrorMessage'
        links:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/Links'
    PortingResponse«NumberAdditionalInformationVO»:
      type: object
      properties:

          $ref: '#/components/schemas/NumberAdditionalInformationVO'
        messages:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortingResponseErrorMessage'
        links:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/Links'
        status:
          type: string
          description: |
            Response status:
             * success - Request was served as expected, successfully
             * fail - Request was rejected due to a client error such as invalid format or schema
             * error - Request wasn't served successfully due to a server error
          example: success
          enum:
            - success
            - fail
            - error
    PortingResponse«Page«PortInRequestVO»»:
      type: object
      properties:
        data:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/Page«PortInRequestVO»'
        messages:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortingResponseErrorMessage'
        links:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/Links'
        status:
          type: string
          description: |
            Response status:
             * success - Request was served as expected, successfully
             * fail - Request was rejected due to a client error such as invalid format or schema
             * error - Request wasn't served successfully due to a server error
          example: success
          enum:
            - success
            - fail
            - error
    PortingResponse«PortInRequestVO»:
      type: object
      properties:
        data:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortInRequestVO'
        messages:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/PortingResponseErrorMessage'
        links:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/Links'
        status:
          type: string
          description: |
            Response status:
             * success - Request was served as expected, successfully
             * fail - Request was rejected due to a client error such as invalid format or schema
             * error - Request wasn't served successfully due to a server error
          example: success
          enum:
            - success
            - fail
            - error
    UserRequiredInformationVO:
      type: object
      properties:
        documents:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/DocumentRequiredInformationVO'
        endUser:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/EndUserRequiredInformationVO'
    Links:
      type: array
      description: List of links/URIs for related resources to the request.
      items:
        type: object
        properties:
          rel:
            type: string
            example: self
          href:
            type: string
            example: http://beta.voxbone.com/porting-api/ports
          type:
            type: string
            description: Allowed method type on the resource. Eg. GET,POST,PATCH
            example: GET
            enum:
              - GET
              - POST
              - PUT
              - PATCH
              - DELETE
        description: >-
          Link to a related resource. `rel` defines the relevance and `href` has
          the URI to access the resource.
    WhitelistApiResponse:
      type: object
      properties:
        _links:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/Link'
        data:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/WhitelistDidObject'
        messages:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/WhitelistApiResponseErrorMessage'
        status:
          type: string
          description: Status of the HTTP response from the API.
          enum:
            - success
            - fail
            - error
    WhitelistApiResponseErrorMessage:
      type: object
      properties:
        description:
          type: string
          description: Detailed error information.
    WhitelistDidObject:
      required:
        - countryCodeA3
        - e164
        - zone
      type: object
      properties:
        countryCodeA3:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Indicates the country code of the DID in its ISO 3166-1 alpha-3
            format (e.g. 'GBR' for United Kingdom, 'USA' for United States of
            America, 'BEL' for Belgium, etc.).
          example: GBR,USA,BEL
        e164:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The DID in its E164 format (e.g. +16469185038) with the ability to
            provide multiple E164s.
        reference:
          type: string
          description: The reference for the customer.
        zone:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Zone is the trunk that you would like to use with the number you are
            activating. E.g. WORLD, A, B, C, GBR, CAN, USA, etc... If you use
            Bandwidth on a PAYG model, you should not add the Zone field in your
            query.
    Link:
      type: object
      properties:
        href:
          type: string
        rel:
          type: string
        type:
          type: string
    WhitelistApiListResponse:
      type: object
      properties:
        _links:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/Link'
        data:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/WhitelistDidObject'
        filters:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/WhitelistPageFilters'
        message:
          type: string
          description: Detailed error information.
        pagination:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/Pagination'
        status:
          type: string
          description: Status of the HTTP response from the API.
          enum:
            - success
            - fail
    WhitelistPageFilters:
      type: object
      properties:
        countryCodeA3:
          type: string
    Pagination:
      type: object
      properties:
        limit:
          type: integer
          description: A limit on the number of records to be returned.
          format: int32
        offset:
          type: integer
          description: >-
            Indicates the number of records that have been skipped before the
            first record is selected.
          format: int32
        order:
          type: string
        sort:
          type: string
        total:
          type: integer
          description: Total number of records.
          format: int64
      description: An object which contains pagination information related to the response.
  securitySchemes:
    apiKey:
      type: apiKey
      description: >
        Authentication to Bandwidth's global API is handled via key based
        authentication. You can manage your API key on our [Global
        Portal](https://www.bandwidth.com/login/) under **Settings > API**.
      name: apikey
      in: header
